If none present, lazy-loads View\MustacheView instance.
Renders a template, with any view model provided, and injects the content into the response object.
Always returns a new view model instance, cloned from the instance in $viewModelPrototype. If no prototype exists, creates one from View\MustacheViewModel.
Halts execution, and sets the response status code to $status, as well as sets the response body to the provided message (if any). Any previous content in the response body will be overwritten.
Stops execution immediately, returning the response as it currently stands.
Stop execution, and redirect to the provided location.

docblock.description: Base view model for use with Mustache.
docblock.long-description: The main purpose of this class is to provide the view model with the App instance, thus giving it access to the various helper methods available in that class. Additionally, it provides an instance of Escaper, allowing you to do context-specific escaping within helpers you define in the view model.
Receive and set the App instance as a protected property. If an Escaper instance is passed, it will be assigned; otherwise, an Escaper instance will be instantiated and assigned.

docblock.description: Bind a helper within the view model object's context
docblock.long-description: Allows using '$this' within the helper in order to access public properties and methods. Binds the helper to the public property given by $name.

docblock.description: Retrieve and/or set the route name

Sets the route name if a non-empty string is provided, and then returns the Route instance to allow a fluent interface.
Otherwise, returns the route name.
